scene.speaker: Ada
scene.text: These two programs are very similar.

scene.speaker: Ada
scene.text: But it would be weird if they are the same.

scene.speaker: Ada
scene.text: What do you think the difference is?

answerList: In the program on top, If the second sensor on the left stays covered, Thymio will not change his top LEDs to green if the left most sensor is uncovered.
In the program on top, Thymio will only change his top LEDs to green once.
In the program on top, Thymio will never change his top LEDs to green.
In the program below, Thymio will only change his LEDs to green if the second sensor from the left is uncovered and then covered again.
In the program on top, it is possible for Thymio to change his top LEDs to green even if the second sensor from the left stays covered.

options.speaker: Ada
options.text: Ah! That's how it is. Because in the first program, the green top color action only reacts to the second sensor from the left and doesn't care about the one all the way on the left.

options.speaker: Thymio
options.text: No, the difference is that in the program on top, If the second sensor on the left stays covered, the top LEDs will not change to green if the left most sensor becomes uncovered.

options.speaker: Thymio
options.text: Because in the first program, the green top color action only reacts to the second sensor from the left and doesn't care about the one all the way on the left.

scene.text: While Thymio and Ada discuss the program, Ruby lands on the cliff to get a closer look.
As soon as Ada notices him, he flies away again.
Ada looks at the program again, making sure she understands it.
